title: Did Freddie Mercury of Queen work out? He always seemed fit in his concerts? - Quora

response.answer_text: He says he didn’t, but I don’t know if he needed to because Queen toured more than any band ever and the stages were huge. In the last concerts he did the stage was enormous and he would jog along it and then sing. In order to do anything like that you would have to be in phenomenal shape just because you would be out of breath. On stage at Wembley he did some push ups. I know he hated gyms and there is no way he even could have gone to one cause he was so recognizable, but I know he most likely did things at home such as push ups etc. After the 1986 tour he was photographed playing tennis in Ibiza and had put on a little weight maybe like 10 pounds. That was because he had stopped touring by then, we all know why….and I just think he was naturally a fit guy. I asked the same thing and from the extensive reading I have done he didn’t “workout” per se. It was more he did things to stay fit he didn’t eat much he’s been quoted as saying and his running around on stage makes me tired just looking at him. He has stairs on the stages and he never stops jumping or something so the amount of cardio alone he does on tour is enough to keep any weight off him. His personal assistant and the man he lived with as his husband towards the end of his life said he was just naturally fit and probably due to his Parsee heritage he didn’t dye his hair it was naturally jet black. It has been rumored he dyed it at Live Aid but the evidence of the dye bleeding apparently, is not visible to me so I have no clue what they are talking about. I do know he would sometimes use black shoe polish before going on stage to darken his hair for the lights and to slick it back. But dying it with dye no. There were a LOT of things amazing about him not just his voice, but he was just simply an amazing human in so many ways. EDIT: Two more things I would like to add is all the moves that Freddie does when he is onstage are things that if you have ever had a trainer they will make you do. Squats which he does a lot running, dancing, he does lunges, all kinds of things that would keep you fit. It’s also well known that Queen toured a lot, and to be a little inappropriate, sex burns a lot of calories and if Freddie is correct about getting “fucked every night” like he says which I don’t think was an exaggeration, then he’s burning tons of calories that way too. I remember a direct quote from one of his NY Daughters saying that he had a nice home gym in his New York apartment, but it was the most unused in the whole apartment. PF says he had those for his friends not for him. I think he might have had one in Garden Lodge as well. He also was incredibly hyper and basically sitting still was something he really couldn’t do that well. He managed when he had to but it wasn’t easy. The funny trend now is that some artists when they go on tour tend to get bigger on tour than they normally are. That was never a problem with Freddie Mercury or any of the rest of them.

Freddie was naturally very fit. His body was like that. he always said he never did exercise. But he was constantly in action doing something, he was hyperactive. Add to that doing tours is very very hard physically ( and mentally too )so he needed to be fit for the tours but a the same time tours were sport themselves . He also played tennis and ping pong but not that often. I heard by someone I don’t remember who ( but someone reliable ) that before tours, especially the magic tour Freddie prepared his body a little bit, doing some gym at home but never something very very serious. that being said Freddie has always been sporty, I mean he didn’t have a bodybuilder body but when he was young he was very talented in boxing and tennis table and every sports. Even though he hated running. if you observe well, in the 70s his body was very very thin and in the 80s he Was stronger,his upper body was much more muscular. (also, for everyone who’s a native English speaker reading my answer, I’m not English and a try to improve my grammar and vocabulary in English so could you tell me my mistakes in comments please ! It could help me speaking better :))! )

Thats such a great question!! So no!!!!! I’ve read that he was just one of those people with a naturally good body. The jumping up and down you saw if you watched ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’ before he enters the Live Aid stage? Think that’s our guy. I’m currently reading a book by one of Queen’s roadies. Name the guy goes by is Ratty, I do believe… lol. He gives the same type of description. I can picture Freddie sitting there, Ratty tying his shoes (costume assistance, don’t you know lol) readying his voice with tea and honey…..ayeeee ohhhhh!!!! ….sparking the room with his awesome personality and wild vibe….getting up and jumping his way toward the stage….running out and killingggg it the moment he hits the stage!!!!!!

According to Peter Freestone’s book (Freddie's assistant), Freddie didn't excersise much. That doesn't mean he sat on the couch all day. Freddie is described as a person who could never sit still and do nothing for long. He was constantly busy and moving around. He recreationally played tennis, but not much. The most excersise he got, was all the insane movements on stage, and the running around. But let's keep in mind that he was increbily blessed with a limber and flexible body. He was already gifted athletically. Don't forget, Freddie LOVED clubbing. Which is a whole different kind of excersise with all the sex and dancing. Additionally, Freddie was appearance conscious. It was important to him how he looked. So while he didn't excersise much, he probably ate very well which attributes to the “fitness image” he sported.

He was a rock star. I regard him highly, but Freddie was thin, not athletic. A rock star diet of alcohol, cigarettes and assorted drugs will give anyone a thin, fat-less frame. I think his exuberance on stage was off pure adrenaline and lust for life, not from some unseen fitness regimen. Much of his time, when not engaging in said lifestyle, was creating music, writing songs. Nowhere have I read that he worked out, or did exercise, but I’m sure he did to some extent.

Most sources say that no, he didn’t, but I remember hearing a radio interview with Freddie that took place after he injured his knee onstage in 1984. He mentioned that he used to lift weights, but had to stop because of that injury. I don’t know if he ever resumed weight training after that, though.
